headers.description: `headers` is a list of BTC headers. Typically: - A given delta of headers a user wants to add to the tip of, or fork the BTC chain.

oneOf.description:
`slashing` is a slashing event from the BTC staking contract.

This will be forwarded over IBC to the Babylon side for propagation to other Consumers, and Babylon itself

BtcHeader.description:
Bitcoin header.

Contains all the block's information except the actual transactions, but including a root of a [merkle tree] committing to all transactions in the block.

This struct is for use in RPC requests and responses. It has convenience trait impls to convert to the internal representation (`BlockHeader`), and to the Babylon extended representation (`BtcHeaderInfo`). Adapted from `BlockHeader`.

bits.description: The target value below which the blockhash must lie, encoded as a a float (with well-defined rounding, of course).

merkle_root.description: The root hash of the merkle tree of transactions in the block. Encoded as a (byte-reversed) hex string.

nonce.description: The nonce, selected to obtain a low enough blockhash.

prev_blockhash.description: Reference to the previous block in the chain. Encoded as a (byte-reversed) hex string.

version.description:
Originally protocol version, but repurposed for soft-fork signaling.

### Relevant BIPs

* [BIP9 - Version bits with timeout and delay](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0009.mediawiki) (current usage) * [BIP34 - Block v2, Height in Coinbase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0034.mediawiki)

Evidence.description: Evidence is the evidence that a finality provider has signed finality signatures with correct public randomness on two conflicting Babylon headers

block_height.description: `block_height` is the height of the conflicting blocks

canonical_app_hash.description: `canonical_app_hash` is the AppHash of the canonical block

canonical_finality_sig.description: `canonical_finality_sig` is the finality signature to the canonical block, where finality signature is an EOTS signature, i.e., the `s` in a Schnorr signature `(r, s)`. `r` is the public randomness already committed by the finality provider. Deserializes to `SchnorrEOTSSig`

fork_app_hash.description: `fork_app_hash` is the AppHash of the fork block

fork_finality_sig.description: `fork_finality_sig` is the finality signature to the fork block, where finality signature is an EOTS signature. Deserializes to `SchnorrEOTSSig`

fp_btc_pk.description: `fp_btc_pk` is the BTC PK of the finality provider that casts this vote

pub_rand.description: `pub_rand is` the public randomness the finality provider has committed to. Deserializes to `SchnorrPubRand`
